result.execSummary:
The defendant Brenda K Sosin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brenda K Sosin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry
Surety Information
Order for payment of attorney fees of $373.05
Petition for payment of attorney fees
Restitution Disbursed to Walmart per 6/15/15 order.
with elements attached
Criminal Case Settlement
Restitution Request and Order to Disburse in the amount of $1200

Case called at 1:15pm [mo]
Defendant Brenda K Sosin in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction be entered. 

ADA Hall submits to the Court a Victim Impact Panel and Order to Disburse
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

Since the restitution was paid prior to sentencing the Court does not order restitution as a condition of probation.

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo any assessment or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--No presence at the Wal-Mart in Jefferson, WI unless approved by Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay court appointed attorney fees

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 1:39pm
Status conference on June 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling notice

[MK] case called at 2:06pm. 
Defendant Brenda K Sosin in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Jeffrey Shock  appear for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Defense stands mute.  Plea of "not guilty" entered by the Court on the Defendant's behalf; speedy trial is waived by Defense.

The Court requires $500 signature bond, with no special conditon.
recess 2:11pm 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/6/15 at 2:00pm (2)  Status Conference on 6/15/15 at 1:00pm

Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection
